data.title: RICHARD LOUGH ROSSER
data.meta_description: RICHARD LOUGH ROSSER passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Pittsburgh Post Gazette on 2024-07-30.
data.text:
ROSSER

RICHARD LOUGH

Richard Lough Rosser, 72, cherished husband, father, father-in-law, grandpap, brother, uncle and friend passed away peacefully on July 27, 2024, surrounded by his beloved family.

Richard was born January 31, 1952, in Bridgeville, PA to William Frank Rosser and Florence Lough Rosser. He graduated from West Virginia Wesleyan where, upon graduation, he met the love of his life, Vicky (Webster). After traveling the world and living in Germany, they settled in Herndon, Virginia. There he built a beautiful life as an adored educator in Fairfax County for over two decades. After Vicky's passing, he returned to his hometown for retirement.

Richard is survived by his two children, Andrew William Rosser and his wife Monica of Naples, FL and Cassandra Webster Rosser of Pittsburgh, PA. He relished in being grandpap to Oliver Alexander Rosser and Frederick Richard Rosser. Grandpap was generous, loving, and always thrilled to see his boys, blowing kisses to each other until the very end.

He is lovingly remembered as the brother of the late Sandra (Rosser) and Donald Thomas of Upper St. Clair; uncle of John (Julienne) and Holland (Derrick Alvarez); great-uncle to Jackson and Giselle Thomas; brother-in-law of Kathy Cooper (Philip) and David Webster; uncle of Dan (Lauren), Michael, and Benjamin Cooper. He was predeceased by his beloved Vicky and his dog Samie, who are now reunited forever.

Arrangements by BEINHAUER FUNERAL HOME. Family and friends are welcome on Saturday, August 3, 2024, from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. in Beinhauer Funeral Home, 2828 Washington Road, McMurray, PA 15317, 724-941-3211. A funeral service will be held in the Funeral Home Chapel starting at 1:00 p.m.

Published on July 30, 2024

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
